title: To what extent should sex ed be taught? - Quora

response.answer_text: Sex ed should be taught to the extent that You know what purpose does each sex-related part of a human body haveYou know about pregnancy and what causes itYou know that women have a menstruation cycle and what different parts of it signifyYou know that contraception comes in different shapes and you know where to get it or ask for itYou know what doctors exist for treating sexual-health-related issues and pregnancyYou know that sex isn't only heterosexual and that gender isn't only cisYou know that different people have different preferences in sexYou are familiar with consentYou know that there are educational sites and people who can answer sex-related questions, and that there is no shame in askingYou know what happens when you don't know any of that, and that it's often a big deal, and when I say big, I mean life-and-death big

To a much greater extent than it is, as a quick glance on Quora will show. Look around here on Quora. You will find questions like: Can I get pregnant the first time I have sex?Can my boyfriend and I give each other STDs if we don’t have any?Can I give myself an STD by masturbating?If my boyfriend and I have sex a week before my period, might I be pregnant?Can I get pregnant if I give my boyfriend a blowjob?Does gay sex cause STDs?Clearly, sexual education is failing. Clearly, parents are not stepping up to the job. Clearly, people are ending up with confused and in some cases dangerous misinformation about sex and health. Your child needs sex education. Yes, even parents who have only a sixth-grade science education and freak out about the idea that there might be more than two genders.
